lines.text: Dranzel glances over. (laughs) "Good luck."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can also put some beds out in the workshop which has now been vacated.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog, carry some beds around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long are you guys staying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's like, "I'm happy to sleep here. This is fine "by me. Just give me a flat surface." He goes over to one of the tables and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that Zed the drummer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he's the drummer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So he doesn't steal stuff. Where are you going, perv?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where are you going, perv? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's all turn in, shall we?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's turn in!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to stay up and keep an eye on the doors when they go into their rooms and make sure they actually stay-- actually, no, I'm going to go find Jareth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jarett, you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jarett.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been that week.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Aw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I shove Keyleth into her room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (slurred) Good night, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You arrange beds for those who need it, for the most part down in the dungeon area. A couple of rooms are crowded with other folks, except for Kaylie, who is following you, Scanlan, with a bottle of wine and two glasses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh dear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's going to rob you blind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's that good of a flute player. She asks you about your history and your travels and how you met Dr. Dranzel, and everything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I tell her all the best parts, and leave out the naughty bits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Interesting tale."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kingslayer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Leader of the rebellion.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So you've said, a number of times, aye." She drinks a little bit more of the wine, sets it down. "I guess I should tell you a bit "more about myself, then."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, please, I'm fascinated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I grew up in Kymal, mostly, before moving to Westrunn to train at the College of the "White Duke. Finest of the bards, he was."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yes he--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My mom gave all her savings to put me up there. Now, I only joined the troop about six "months back. It was my third year at the Duke's when the good doctor came through and, well, I "seized the opportunity. Now, to be perfectly honest up-front, I've already heard a bit about "your tales, Shorthalt. (chuckles) The Charming of the Pauper Prince, your rendition of the Summer "Sunder, the Cliffs of Dagger Bay. I've been hoping our paths would cross."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) Wait--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're not there, Drunky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're drunk, go to sleep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (wheezing) Cliffs of Dagger Bay! Go ahead!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dagger Bay's just a place.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing) What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I'm flattered, and, you have quite talent for-- quite a lot of talent for just been playing with the troop for six months. I was impressed by that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you very much. You know where I've heard most of these stories? "My mother, Sybil."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Being the only tiny, female fair folk in such a rural town means being preyed upon, so "I learned to use a blade quickly, and to wield my charm just as viciously. Seems that runs in the "family, aye?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I-- oh, I-- (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I practiced. I stole. Lied about my age and eventually paid my way into the Duke's College so "I could find you. Prove you a scoundrel." At this point, you see her stand up, and she begins to draw a small blade from her side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's going to fight me!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This day, Scanlan Shorthalt, I beat you at your own song. Now I come to take your dignity. Now "take up your sword."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Holy shit--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: First of all, Kaylie, it's so wonderful to meet you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Don't try that with me."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't know! Listen, I have my faults, for sure, but (stammers) I didn't know that you existed! I would have, I would have come to visit, I would have come to meet you-- how can you fault me for something that I did not know about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you even remember Sybil?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, could you describe her a little more detailed? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a wisdom check. Roll a d20, add your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, wisdom? Which is a negative two. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. You vaguely recall Sybil. She-- golden hair, very eager to escape her simple beginnings, and very clingy very quickly. You jumped out of there very fast, from your perspective.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She really, lot of-- hands-y, sort of, I mean, I think I remember her quite well. And she was a wonderful person, and you should be honored to have such a wonderful person as your parent, and not someone like me, because I was a scoundrel, you're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are a scoundrel."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have been, in past moments in my life, a scoundrel, I've--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you even realize you nearly invited your daughter up to sleep with you?" (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You don't care."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like I wouldn't have let it go that far? I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You have no boundaries. You take what you like and you keep walking on. You trick folk. Now "draw your blade."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check. With advantage, for that speech.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Persuasion?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With advantage!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It won't matter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a manipulation check?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No shit, it won't matter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh? She rolled high, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit. She's big.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A bard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she stands there with her blade out, staring at you, you can see the veins in her neck tensing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I slowly unbutton my shirt and show her my chest and say, "Stab me right here, if you'd like, "and I will not resist. You've earned it. Take me."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts) And she thrusts forward-- -- and rolls a natural one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A natural one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, a natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she goes to strike towards you, even in that moment, her will falters and the blade falls limp. It hits your chest, and you feel the piercing of something pushing into your flesh, but no more than maybe half an inch, as there's no real force behind the blade. As the hand releases her weapon, it clatters to the ground as her momentum carries her arms around your shoulders.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she holds you there, her tousled, short pixie brown hair, you can feel the wetness across the back of your neck, and you hear her voice trembling in your ear say, "Why? Why can't I do "it? All the years building up to this and I have the chance, and I can't do it."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, I'm so sorry that you're going through this, and I'm more sorry that you're going through this by yourself, but I think deep down you're a Shorthalt, and there's something that you have that's connected to me and I to you, and perhaps I misread that as some sort of-- ugh-- icky attraction, and I apologize, but I've known for a while now that something is missing in my life, some sort of focus, and some sort of moral compass. Maybe it's just arrived at my doorstep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "In some ways, it's what's kept me alive this long. I've got a lot to think about. I'm going to go for a "walk. (sighs) I need some fresh air." And she closes the door behind her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I sit for a moment and think about everything, try to remember more about Sybil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a lot of faces blurring, this is-- You worked your way through a lot of Tal'Dorei in those days, you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She wasn't that giant. No, she was. Okay. And I have a very restless night thinking about everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And with that, we're going to go ahead and take a bathroom break. We'll be back here in five minutes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Amazing, amazing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So good! You.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You avoided a showdown in your bedroom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With my daughter!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She was ready to. We'll be back here real fast, take this, a quick break, quick as we can, because we have a lot to get through before we get to Critmas. We'll see you here in just a few minutes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Damn!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: [break]

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Balls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going to get awesome art and a cool package of games and stuff, it'll be really awesome, so congrats. All right, so. Jumping back in. The morning comes around, consciousness comes to all of you, you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I had, in the night I had gone to find Jarett.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh right, Jarett, sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just to tell him to keep an eye on the rooms and everything. Because, you know, I'm sure they're all great people, but-- I know they have some shady practices, so. I just want to make sure that--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's my daughter you're talking about, by the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't know that yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm happy to take care of this for you." He loads his crossbow and plops himself down at the edge of the hall where he has a view of every single door at the south end of the keep. And he's, like, perched and ready. All right. You guys come to consciousness the next morning, more hungover than others, depending on the individual. Come down, breakfast has already been prepared and waiting. (laughs) Poor Laina's been trying to keep it warm for you, and part of it's already being eaten by your guests, who, half of them fell asleep in the actual dining room. Nevertheless, all of you come down. Scanlan, you eventually come out of your confused reverie. Not a lot of good sleep throughout the evening and Kaylie never came back throughout the night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mm. Is Dr. Dranzel around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Poor Laina is not designed to produce breakfast for over 11 people in a morning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Old friend, a quick word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Good morning, Scanlan."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "About?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you know? About the girl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What did she do?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What did she do?" And you can see, he looks a little worried now. He's checking his pockets.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does he seem-- Can I insight check him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, make an insight check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three. Seems pretty genuine. Yeah, he's hard to read beyond hung over and mildly confused. And you spent a lot of time with him, so you know his demeanor pretty well. But yeah, he seems genuinely like (stutters) "If she's done anything wrong, let me know. She's part of my troupe. I take "responsibility for her."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no. She's a fine player and a fine, upstanding person, and you should take special interest in her. She's a good one. Please, if she continues on with your troupe, take good care of her, all right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. As long as she keeps bringing in the change and doesn't piss me off, I think we're good."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She might. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Takes his hat and puts it on, finishes his breakfast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I check around? Look around the keep and make sure-- I mean in the general area and see if anything's missing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So paranoid.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously, I do not trust these people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's our five-thou?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, where is our five-thou? Did it get delivered?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It never got delivered.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, who are you asking?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm asking the guards at the front if anybody came from the keep, from Uriel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Cordell and Shayne are now changing over into the next morning staff. As they're getting their stuff together, the morning staff would be Kendrick--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natibe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- and Natibe, yes. You took notes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wrote them down, it's not a big deal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You pulled a rabbit out of a hat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yeah, as they're changing over, you walk over and ask them. And Shayne goes, "Yeah, no, we "had a messenger come by and drop something off for you guys."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, we gave it to Erwen and he brought it inside, but you guys weren't home."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did it look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A small wooden thing, right?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where did Erwen put it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cordell's like, "Yeah, it was like a small wooden case."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where did you put it? Where did you put it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Erwen took it in."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's Erwen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both look at each other. "Look, our shift's over."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just tell me where the fuck Erwen is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably inside the keep! I don't watch your little old man-servant. I'm sorry. I'm "supposed to watch the front of the gate."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck. I go inside to find Erwen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Erwen, who's dressed up in his proper servant attire now that he has to entertain guests. His hair is slicked back and is a scoop of a balding male dome. "Yes, Vex'ahlia. May I be of "service to you this morning?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You look wonderful today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Box, box, box, where did it go, box? The box that came last night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! Oh yes! No, there was a delivery."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was looking for you all, but no one was home. So I asked around if anyone had seen you and "your guests said that you would be coming and that they would hold it for you until you arrived."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Our guests did?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughing) Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Our guests did? I go storming into the breakfast area. Dr. Dre!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dra.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dr. Dra. Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's stood up and put his hat on. "Ah, yes!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. You had the best night's sleep here, I bet? So comfortable? Lots of wine? That box, give it to me now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh! (laughs) Yes, we were making sure that it wasn't pilfered by any untrustworthy types. Of "course, of course."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so kind of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're more than happy to help. You being such fine hosts to us, it's the least we could "do." And he leans over to Kent. (murmurs something) You can read lips.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can read lips. What did he say? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he leans over, he says, "Kent, you better go get the box."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, okay." Steps away, runs up to the guest room that they were staying, comes back down carrying the small chest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much! I open it up and count it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs) It'll take you a little while. It's a lot of coin. You get, for about the next 30-ish minutes or so, you're counting through and you're starting to get towards the bottom of it and you've gotten to about roughly the 3,500-4,000 gold section, before Kent comes up to you behind and takes a small satchel and empties it into the chest as well and goes, "And that as "well, sorry. Keeping it separate, so in case--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In case we got robbed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, you wouldn't lose everything."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's so kind of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thinking ahead."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What nice friends you have, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're so giving.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How was last night, huh?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ugh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretty wild? Thank god the walls are made of stone!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have we all come downstairs or are we all sitting around--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've all, eventually, come downstairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just say I struck out, all right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You? Struck out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I should have a go at her, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! No, no, no! She doesn't like our kind, she's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What is 'our kind' supposed to mean?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's off-limits. I saw her first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait. Are you in love?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, you could say so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did you hear that, Pike?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did I hear what? (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan said he's in love.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With someone else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He said he's in love.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I insight check him? Because it was awfully quiet in your room, Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's normally so loud (laughs).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Insight check. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Were you being honest?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. No, Scanlan seemed pretty honest, if guarded.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Dr. Dranzel is like, "Speaking of which, where is Kaylie? I haven't "seen her all morning."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. She ran off last night. But we should find her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You scared another one away?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could say that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Scanlan. I kind of liked her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's disgusting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Actually, what happened?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's fine. Ask Pike.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike, what happened?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, it's fine! We had so much fun and did shots of fire-something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Water. Fire water.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Grog's idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You had a very good time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You were very passionate. You were like, "I need fire water," I said, "okay."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That sounds like something I'd do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then we planned to investigate a house and possibly pilfer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, yes!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, we did what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we're going to go do that today.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to investigate a house.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, what was the second word you said?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Possibly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The third word you said?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pilfer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, what, what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a bad guy's house, so it'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whose house?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So you remember when we went to General Krieg's house?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll explain on the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't worry about it, Keyleth, we'll talk about it on the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's all good. We're making sure the city is safe from the house. It's empty. We're going to make sure it stays empty and safe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Last time we were there, things attacked us, so we're going to double-check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, the dragon that we provoked. So, you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mysterious things have been happening, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you all want in the house?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you all want in the house?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't know. We don't know what's in the house. It's a mysterious thing to be happening in this town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, just an investigation."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to check it out. We won't do anything untoward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This sounds like nothing we would ever agree to. Ever. We would never agree to investigate a house with nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, somebody said that they were afraid that bad things were coming out of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're now going to go into a house with bad things coming out of it. And we don't know what these bad things are. What did we agree to, Percy? Percy, what did we agree to?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, tell me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We agreed to take a look inside this house and if there was anything valuable we would liberate it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And while you guys do that, we'll wait here and eagerly keep an eye out for Kaylie and--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, please do. And keep a good eye out for her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sure."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And if you have a gig tonight-- Do you have a gig tonight anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not this evening, no."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. You can use our place as a base of operations, but please try not to steal anything else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I wouldn't dream of it, Scanlan."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you would dream of it. You'd absolutely dream of it. Just don't do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tips his hat a little. "Understood."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe we could pay Jarett a little overtime.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I fully, fully intend--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as you turn and look over at the door, Jarett's there with his crossbow, still over on the side, looking in. He glances over.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Let's go check out this house.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want to stay and take a look after these people?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, no need to be coy, stinky.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not going to go stealing from some house--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not stealing, we're investigating.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- when you guys aren't even giving me all the information.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe if somebody wasn't so drunk last night, they would've had the information.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very fair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, maybe if I didn't have friends who were such douchebags.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She is the worst drunk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we leave.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't even get to see the sunrise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll make sure you see a sunrise. Now come on. We need you with us anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To keep us honest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy. Pike!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I think we should just go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know, how about we just go? You could wait outside just in case something happens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to steal anything either.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should take a look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Zedd, the rather rotund drummer, has finished eating his breakfast. He's got bits of egg in his beard. He spins around and goes, "You're more than welcome to stay here with us."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, she is, because it's our house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The faster we do this, the faster they leave, at the very least.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't even know what we're doing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It'll be fine. We'll explain it on the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog leaves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who else is coming?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm coming.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket follows before I do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trinket's coming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Trinket is a bear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. A wise bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keyleth, seriously, I don't want to steal anything. I want to find out why these-- They can't hear me, I'm whispering to her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're already on our way, aren't we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're walking. I want to find out why they want to get into the house. That's all. Something shady's going on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The last time we were there, something looked at us through things on the wall. Right? So it knew where we were and we fled. We have no idea what we left behind. We left in a hurry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And the new owner has also left in a hurry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Let's go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're keeping things safe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we should stay, we shouldn't go to the house-- Yeah, let's fucking go!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Woo, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's tough being the good one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't like them at our keep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're taking the bear or leaving the bear?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're fucking taking the fucking bear!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just a simple question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's my whole fighting fucking thing is I have a fucking bear. That's the whole point of the class that I took. I keep the bear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What kind of classes? Have you been going to night school?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, classes. You know, writing, creative writing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Emon Community College.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I'm learning things, every day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everyone says words. I don't know what all these words mean. What's a douchebag?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can remember how to get back to that house, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just skate over that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, you do come across the familiar site of General Krieg's homestead, the one you infiltrated a little over a year ago. It looks like it's a little dilapidated, but strangely enough, for a person who's purchased this estate, there wasn't much attempt to try and beautify it. The ivy has overgrown the bottom of it. There is still the iron gate around it. It is currently closed and there are no guards posted around it. It looks empty and vacant and dark in the windows. It's about noon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have a look around?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Go around the back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys scoot around to the back side. Anything in particular you're looking for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Any signs of life?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anyone around? Watching?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check. For those who wish to look around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 23 for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a dark interior and you can't really make any details out of the inside from this point, because it is so closed off. Some of the curtains have actually been drawn shut. But not all of them, a few of the windows are open.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about around the house? Outside the house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Outside the house? The grass, the lawn that surrounds this--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or surrounding buildings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Each building has its own color scheme, its own architecture. Each thing is trying to be distinct and different in this microcosm of the societal space of Emon, where most of the gold passes through. They have their own worries about presentation. Which is interesting, because in the middle of all these very beautiful homes, you have General Krieg's home, which is pretty basic, red brick, utilitarian and sticks out like a sore thumb by comparison. Or doesn't stick out at all by comparison, because it's so normal-looking.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I ask you guys, before we do anything, maybe it would be best to tell the guards that we're investigating a disappearance? We've heard things about the house and we need to check inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What guards?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's obviously shady if we go sneaking in, but if we say, "We're going in the house, because "we worry for it," then it's okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we tell them when we go to the bathroom, too?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe, Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're above them in rank.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But the guards have the ability to call higher authority on us and we don't want people--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are there any guards that we can see right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about, there are none in your immediate vicinity. You're not that far from the Citrine Garrison, which is the centerpiece of the higher military folk. And they do have their own guard station about. You're about a ten-minute walk from the palace, which has a number of guards throughout, and you do have some patrols that come through the city. But in the middle of the day in the Cloudtop, it's not as pressing a place for guard presence. So you haven't seen any immediately around you. But I'm sure if you wait for the next 15-20 minutes, one will probably come your way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, they probably have a key to General Krieg's place. We can just barge on in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, it's owned by someone, isn't it? Someone deserted it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did somebody buy it after him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, it's private property.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're being very prudent.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we'll totally wait here while you go tell the guards that we want to go inspect something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're better at this than them. Let's go do what we do. Right, Trinket?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bear noises) As he growls into your ear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How can you resist that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we come across a guard, I'd be happy to inform them of what we're doing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't we at least do a little bit of pre-planning? Do we need like a warrant for something like this?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fuck that. I walk up to the door and knock really loud.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a gate around the outside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a gate.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought we were around the back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys were around back. There's the gate, which is about-- the fence itself is about seven feet tall with little metal impaler spikes on the top.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll hop over that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hop check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! Okay. You deftly avoid falling upon one and spearing your manhood, thankfully. As you grab the edge, (grunts) loftily heft yourself over the top of the gate, landing within the other side of the browning yard that hasn't been well-kept.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hmm. You might want to tell the guard I'm walking on the yard. Let them know I'm going. And I go off towards the house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog walks away from you guys towards the house brazenly in the middle of the midday sun.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grog, that rhymed! Well done!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anybody want a peanut?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I stand next to Vex, irritated.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And during that whole exchange, I've been changing cloaks and putting on the red one. Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Subtle. So stealthy now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't need to be subtle, I'm just standing around, you guys are arguing, he's making a fool of you, I'm just changing my cloak. I have 17 cloaks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you bring around one of those like--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wardrobe racks?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, rolling wardrobe racks

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. It's on wheels, it's on wheels. It's functional.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It bobbles on the cobblestones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going, "Shh! Follow me." (squeaking sound) (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They smoosh up to about the size of a cabbage. It's really all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you have a very wrinkly red cloak on right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know what? Never mind! I think, what I think is that Grog and Pike should lead the way, stealth in, pick all the locks, and I think everything will go really well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a great idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to hang back. I think that's the way to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, you're already at the front door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Brilliant. Boom, boom, boom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog just knocked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys hear in the distance (knocking) as Grog's fist is now hitting--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Walking to the front gate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, I could Skywrite that we're here in the sky again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nobody answers the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no answer at the door!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I try picking the lock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have lockpicks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's going to literally try picking the lock? Yes!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have a lockpick?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take Pike by the hand and go: here you go, chum, and I slap down my set in her hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vex appears seemingly out of nowhere and slaps his lockpicks--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm sorry, Vax. So, Pike. I've gotten much better at that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It happens to everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, you want to try and pick the lock?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Go ahead and roll a d20 and add your dexterity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to inspire her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With a limerick.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no way this is not good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'm going to inspire her. There once was a gnome with a mace. Who had an adorable face. She never would bed me, but I hope she won't forget me. 'Cause oh how I do love the chase.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Aw!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a real easy d10 inspiration die for you, Pike.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a panty-dropper, as Sam would say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go ahead and roll a d20, add your dexterity modifier.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is what?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So in addition to the 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, well, what'd you roll?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Then what's your dexterity modifier?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a seven. Now go ahead and roll a d10 and add that to it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I rolled a nine.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That helps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Wow. Okay, that puts you at a 15, which is actually directly the DC of the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Even better!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody, meet your new rogue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. With the rattle of metal plate, the untrained eye, and a couple times you hear the metal (creaking) beginning to bend as she, having no previous experience really with lockpicks from what you know, you're afraid she's going to break your toolset. However, she's picked up a few things while she was at sea with, you know, more of the swashbuckling brigades over the western shores, and much to your surprise, she (click, opening sound). The door opens and the dark interior of the home is at your disposal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: See, this is our problem. We've been approaching doors without Pike! We need Pike!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach down and high-five Pike.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She pushes massive statues, she unlocks all doors.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I stick my head in the door and I go: hello? Is anyone home?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I give his pick back to him. And I say: it was just luck, Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shut up, baby. I know it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I lean back and I go: there's nobody answering from inside. Vex, you might want to go tell the guard no one's inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Asshole. I feel like we have a blessing of Sarenrae though to go inside.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you step into the home a little bit, the first thing you notice is the smell. Immediate, pungent scent of decay hits your nose. The source is not in immediate visual range and you can't really tell what type of decay it is, but it's a definitively terrible smell, and one that permeates the interior of the foyer. Foyer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It smells like roses inside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm coming in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you come in. It's an experience as you guys walk in, it catches you off guard and you stand, the main foyer open before you, the only light currently within the interior is the bit of sunlight that's bouncing in from the front open doors and a few of the windows in the distance. To your left is a dining room, there's a big red carpet in the center of the room, there's tapestries put all-- actually, the decor in here is much more garish than you recall. When you were last here it was very simple, it was very minimalist, and you got the impression that the house for the most part was not being lived in outside of the servant. You recall there was a passageway across from the foyer that led to a gallery and that which had the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The trap room, the little portal in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. The false wall in the back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh right. Behind the tapestry, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's find the source of the smell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket is actually really good at sniffing things out, so maybe he can lead us to the smell.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Good boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket comes sniffing up. (sniffing sounds) Go ahead and make a perception check for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. It's too much, it's advantage because of his smell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: True.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, those sucked both times.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shut up. Shit, they do. 16?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's good!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Enough to open a door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drink, food, but is completely molded over to the point where parts of it have bloated and spilled off and liquid has-- the putrescence has spread across part of the surface.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oof, I throw the gas mask on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been there for quite some time, you don't know quite how long.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Free food, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know, it smells pretty good in here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there dust on the ground? Has it been that long?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you check down, you put your finger across it, and it is a little dusty. It's not been an extremely long period of time but there is a layer of dust.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there anything changing the dust? Is there any tracks in it or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently from what you can see, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have we all entered?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've all begun to walk into the foyer, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's search the upstairs first, see if there's a body or otherwise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh god, this isn't helping with the hangover.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does the smell get more intense at the food?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, the smell gets more intense as you enter the dining room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, so it's the food.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I almost can't smell you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I Druidcraft the table and take like the decaying food and maybe, I don't know, grow some flowers out of it, try to make it look nice?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Compost it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Try and compost it, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whereas once was a nasty spore cloud-based fungus, you've now converted almost into a colored mushroom-type presentation

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't eat it, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll probably lessen the stench over time, but no immediate effect as the smell has been hanging here stagnant for quite a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like a big old terrarium now

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So it's a big old house. Can we like split up and get it over with?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Split the party.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Split the party!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've all got earrings, let's start checking rooms and we'll get to the room that we know is iffy last.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. So wait, we're checking all the rooms that are probably okay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. I'm going to start upstairs, check the bedrooms.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You mean the not okay part being the teleportation room?

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's up, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I cast Spirit Guardians to be around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. What is the duration on that one?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ten minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you guys are walking in, Pike clasps her holy symbol and closes her eyes for a second and you begin to see these almost glowing orbs, like these ghostly entities that begin to swirl and follow around you. Similar in the spirit stuff of Pike's form when she was alongside you guys in Whitestone. Who's heading upstairs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go upstairs with Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anybody else?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, I'll go upstairs, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a downstairs? Like a cellar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The downstairs would be the path that you found last time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And that's it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't inspect the rest of the house at that point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's lots of downstairs rooms.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should remind everyone you are immune to poison, you are immune to cursed, you've got a bonus on wisdom saving throws, and plus 1d10 temporary hitpoints.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's from the Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Poison, charm-- what was it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Curse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me remember them all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, well, you guys go upstairs and we'll clear out this floor before we go anywhere else and we'll wait for you to come back down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll stay on the middle floor. I'll be team middle floor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As Vex, Scanlan, and Percy head towards the stairway, they step across the red carpet in the center of the foyer-- I need all three of you to make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I didn't say perception, shit balls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Dexterity, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (crackling).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They didn't make it out of the room, right? This is in the room that we're all in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is in the foyer. You guys just now went, "All right, we're doing this, go!" (impact) It's not even two steps into your plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're all still there, we can see him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you all see Scanlan currently now trapped in this force cage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Full on Ghostbuster-ing. Don't mime, don't mime.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, hang on. Let's just leave him for a minute. Let's just leave him. Can we leave him? I can fix this. I could fix it, (whispers) but why don't we leave him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, roll another dexterity check

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit, it's closing on me, isn't it? Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You can see the cage itself, its unstable energy occasionally arcs across like a Tesla coil and you manage to dodge out of the way and you can see now this cage not just holds you in place, but it also perpetually tries to damage those who are captured.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I feel a little bad. I'll let him out. Dispel Magic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! You've got that!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Keyleth waves her hand now the entire force cage vanishes into the air.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you guys see that? I was like in an aquarium.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was kind of fun to watch, I'm not going to lie.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you were like a dick in a box.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Step one. Let's go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gently checking for traps as we go up the stairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you Keyleth, I take it back about your breath.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I will say for the purposes of this, everyone roll an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone who's going upstairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone roll an investigation check. This is investigation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The three of you going upstairs: you find no further traps, you go through the rooms on the top floor. You find that where previously most of them were empty, a lot of them have been furnished now but most of the furnishings have been untouched, like the house was being set up to be almost like a summer home or a side home, but no signs of life; everything seems to have the same layer of dust you found on the floor in the foyer. There is no real wealth being kept here, 'cause I know that's probably what you're looking for. It looks like whoever had intended to, this collector, hadn't quite gotten to the point of wanting to move any of their fortune, their masses, into the upstairs area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it has been largely untouched for a number of months.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we go down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now what did you roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys take a little while to pore through the kitchen, you find a basement, you open the latch and go down and look throughout and it smells mildewed down there, but from general dampness, almost like recent rainy weather soaked into the ground soil there and was left to mildew a bit. You don't find any other signs of life, looking about all the rooms. You find the music room, there's the main living den area; mostly it's almost like a showroom like everything was set up but then never had the chance to actually host anyone or someone to actually live there and enjoy it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any further signs like the feast of people leaving in a hurry? That seems like someone was here and left really fast? A suitcase, or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can tell, the meal that was prepared, the pots and pans and stuff that were used to cook it are currently in a small basin that carries a little bit of still water that's been slowly evaporating over time with bits of dried food crusted around the sides. The meal itself appears to have been abandoned not in haste, there's no signs of a struggle, the fork is still resting partially in the now mushroom fungus-covered pile. Even getting near it you're still like (disgusted grunt) but there's no previous sign of a struggle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How big was the feast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looked like it was just made for one person.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any, like, sculptures? Or pieces of art downstairs? Or desks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, there are a number of rather garish tapestries around. A number of them are of different animals running and hunting and chasing, not in a very beautiful way, but the kind that you'd, you know, find at an airport.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like the Denver airport?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, like Kinkade "Burst of Light."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, you paint a picture there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. They're all thematic and similar and none of them seem to have any other theme other than whoever ordered them seems to like animals.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No historical acts, no mythology, nothing like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not in this current setup.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I Detect Magic on any of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you scoot through and using-- do you have Detect Magic memorized?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. I wanted to arcane it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then make an arcana check to inspect and see if you see any signs of--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not good at it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still mildly hungover.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, still really hungover. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. Going from place to place, nothing seems to jump out at you as enchanted or any sort of arcane nature. The only room you haven't inspected yet is the hallway across from the foyer, the one that led into the original gallery room and then into the hidden--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The funhouse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's all go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we check the fucking carpet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, teleportation circle. Remember there were a shitton of traps before we got to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's up, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I do a religion check to see if there's any Vecna stuff here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, smart move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, make a religion check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Looking about and keeping this in mind, you don't see any sort of religious iconography. Any of the artwork, any of the small knickknacks that are throughout the den, nothing here speaks of any sort of religious connotation, or at least whoever has decorated this place did so purely out of visual aesthetic choice. So yeah, nothing catches your attention in this room.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go. Who's going first? Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike then Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Pike, Grog-- what's the rest of the marching order here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket, then me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does Pike get a cloak?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then Vax's wardrobe rack, then me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's got to go behind, I have to pull it behind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I get that invisibility cloak again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's almost like a biblical-type very artistic representation of the creation of the different planes. You've seen it done before--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that the same one that was here last time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, same one. There are a number of small cylindrical platforms that rise up in the center of this room. You see on the first sets a series of bronze busts of a particular man wearing a cloth wrap, a headpiece. His features are still nondescript. There's a lot of detail in the clothing, in the neck wrap and the head wrap. But when it comes to the actual features of the face it's very simple and plain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not enough to recognize anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kind of like a god of secrets?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. I'm actually going to ask you guys to roll a history check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is this, history?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So, glancing at this, the three of you-- you don't recognize the face at all. And the best that you can recall is there have been tales in a far-off continent called Marquet, which is a largely desert landscape. The few bastions of civilization that exist in this desert, there is one central town, referred to as Ank'Harel. You've never been there. You've heard of it. And it's this little oasis in this center of this vast desert.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Oh! Wait!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's where Riskel was going to go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's also where Jarett is from.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jarett's a mole, kill him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you've heard that the city has been lorded over and run in a very benevolent way by an individual referred to as J'mon Sa Ord. The city has existed for about 400 years, and since its existence has been run by J'mon Sa Ord. People don't know if he's human, what he is. But he's apparently lived that long.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long? I didn't hear because I was writing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like even to look into his face still seems like you can't focus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That doesn't sound good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's as much as you can assert. And those thoughts come to you three and you see this bust, these series of busts that seem to depict this individual, and to the best of your knowledge that's probably an artist's depiction of J'mon Sa Ord. Which you've never seen in Tal'Dorei. Or anything of this type of construct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we know that that's where Riskel wanted to go as well. I want to pull out the symbol of Vecna that I took off of Riskel and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we might've-- I feel like that's not also the first time we've heard of Ank'Harel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well Jarett's from there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like even before then, like a long time ago.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I check for traps while they're talking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Marquet is the continent? Correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Ank'Harel is a city within the continent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like a desert continent? The whole continent is like desert?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Desert and mountains.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So it's like Australia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks elongated and the teeth are sharpened. Looks almost elvish. But one eye socket has an uncut rough emerald embedded in the socket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The right socket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This place has been pilfered before and no one took that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go over to the dominoes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to examine the skull.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to help Percy examine the skull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, are you just taking a look at it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm taking a look at it, I'm checking to see if it's attached to the-- it's sitting on a column at the moment?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's part of the collection.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm seeing if it's attached at all and very gently turning it if I don't see any--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you reach out take it and its weight and you lift it off the cylindrical pillar--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was just going to turn it. I wasn't quite going to lift it yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you turn it, it turns freely.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, I give it a little lift.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you do that... nothing happens. It is in your hands. However--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone dies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's heavier than you expected it would be and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god, it's going to talk to me, isn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a part of you that-- like a slight cold chill runs down your spine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A recognizable cold chill, or a brand-new cold chill?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just like every person has that little part in the back of their head that says, "This "probably isn't a good idea, but whatever." (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hate you so much!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you're holding it in your hand, what do you want to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're like a magnet for evil.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a little evil magnet, I know. I'm checking, is the emerald set into the socket or is it removable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's set in the socket, actually, and the emerald-- go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is set with meticulously jewel-crafted gold inlay that actually almost looks like a very deepset filigree that binds it within the socket itself, like it's very deliberately placed. The craftsmanship of the very, very fine gold filigree, and yet the uncut nature of the emerald, seems strange and as you inspect the emerald itself, it seems almost like while the gem itself is stationary, there is the ever-so-faint image of movement within the gem. Almost like a freshly disturbed pond, like a slight ripple of the surface of water, there is just ever-so-slowly shifting within the gem.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I've found something evil.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should not be touching it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, can I do a nature check to see if I can recognize what kind of skull it might be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The skull does not come from any beast that you are familiar with, you've not encountered a creature of this physiology, and it definitely doesn't come from the realm of nature from your understanding.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pike, don't you think you should have a look at it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, can I give it a-- what do you see inside the gem?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like a ripple, almost like a pond that's just gently disturbed. Oh. I have a thought.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is precisely the sort of awful thing that I would design if I wanted a way to look into a hallway. I'm going to place it back on the column, facing the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, do you want to look at it further?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, can I give it a look? I want to look at the tea set too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, I want to go look at the tea set.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's look at the evil skull first.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I do a check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so what are you trying to check about the skull?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know what to check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If it's evil?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that like an arcana check or--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it depends on what nature you're trying to ascertain of the skull. Are you trying to figure--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah well I want to check if it's evil, but I don't know. It seems like it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, we've been talking about--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are spells called Detect Good and Evil.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: -- some fucknut with one eye. I feel like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's Vecna?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's the left eye. He said it's in its right eye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Still, then its left eye is empty.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have it, I have it, I have it, I have it! Let me do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have it memorized?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yep, it's right in here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Evil and Good. All right, so. You take a moment and you focus-- by the way, this is a concentration spell, doing this will get rid of your spirit guardians.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I think that's okay. I think-- that's fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as the orbs that have been rotating around for the past, you know, it's been about ten minutes, they probably would have faded anyway, gently dissipate, you focus your intent on the skull, and this object, while it is not a desecrated object per se, there is an essence inside that does not strike you as moral. There is something about its very nature that does give you pause. You are unable to ascertain the nature, given the fact that you would have to take some time with it to really do so, but you get the feeling that there is some power within it, but probably not the kind that is very fortuitous for someone of your persuasion.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I think it's bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You think it's bad?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's have it face the wall. I don't want it looking at us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I go take the top off the tea set and look inside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You go ahead and take the top off the tea set and look inside; it is empty, it is polished, and the light that comes in as you open the top just refracts the image from the outside of the tea set, and it's just beautiful craftsmanship. The actual gold itself is very smooth on most of the tea kettle, and all the cups themselves all have very very intricate scrolling on them that have been handcarved in; it's a beautiful set. This is like a royal gift. This is something that, you know, people who trade across political boundaries use to, you know, send goodwill to the other side. This is probably worth quite a bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there any stamping on it to like show who it's from or anything like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look on the bottom and it has the initials L.M.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: L.M. L.M. L.M.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Love, Macna.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The street cousin of Vecna.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would recommend that if we are going to... purloin things, we should do it on the way out rather than the way in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Yeah, definitely.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, are the dominoes just like on a table?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, some of them are set on the side, there's a stack, and then a few of them are set up-- it's literally placed in like a nice presentational like QVC style "turn it and look at all the cool dominoes" type.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab the table and I shake it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All the dominoes (scattering sound) scatter and fall off the sides, (clatter sounds) and clinking on the ground, some of the ivory chips a little bit on some of the corners.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing bad seems to happen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think it's evil. I reach down, I pick up one of the ivory die.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It stands there, cold, against the very well, you taste it. As your tongue touches the ivory of the domino, it tastes somewhat salty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I believe it tastes like a domino.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, can we go look at the teleportation thingy now?

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's go down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys make your way to the far back wall of the room and there is that same tapestry that you saw before, it depicts a large storm cloud that is roaring over the cliffs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just going to peek behind the tapestry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a door behind there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You open up the tapestry and it's just a flat stone wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Nothing there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I lick the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Isn't that the same doorway we found before?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we've already done this once, you guys, let's not be crazy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I forgot about that. Where'd my face go?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was just like this last time, except there was brunch. That's all I remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your head passes through, you look about and you can see stairs that descend for about 40 feet into darkness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I grab Scanlan by the scruff and pull him back and then I start in. And I grab my sister by the ear behind me and start pulling her down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So wait, wait. There's the, there's still the tapestry in front of it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's a tapestry in front of it, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take the tapestry off? The wall? I want to like take it and put it over my shoulders and jump a little.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like make it a parachute?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. See if--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it flying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a very heavy tapestry. Most tapestries, the amount of craftsmanship that goes into it, the material-- this one in particular, it falls very very heavily against the wall and doesn't really gather any air or--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In her defense, the last time she tried this, it did fly away. It's not a flying tapestry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I just thought I'd try.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe just put it over top of that skull and keep it hidden for now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I take the tapestry and I put it over the skull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you throw the tapestry on top of the skull--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing happens.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Such an asshole!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just fun to mess with you guys. All right, so you guys progress down the stairway?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception check, perception check, perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20 for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Delight. Glancing in the next room, and this is a small chamber you guys have seen before, it's about 30 feet across, on the far end there is a small, circular stone platform about six inches thick that has deep inset runes carved in a circular pattern across it. It's less polished than the ones you've seen at the Lyceum in Emon, but it is definitively the last teleportation circle you took to the cavern that housed General Krieg where you had your encounter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the last time we were here, I found a safe path through. Do I remember it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. You actually distinctly recall the pattern, to the best of your ability.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Up, up, down, down, left, right, left, right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now I want you to go ahead and make a wisdom check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have advantage. No, wait, that's saving throws. Never mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Use Luck.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could use Luck, yeah. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. Yeah, you recall the exact pattern through. Leading the way, stepping from stone to stone to stone, you guys following his pattern, you manage to make your way, all of you, including Trinket who has to (bear grunts).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He remembers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Guide you through. You make your way all the way across the room to the teleportation circle, and this is the end of this portion of the hallway. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we step onto it? How does it work?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't remember.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we just run ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, does it look like there's been anybody in here since we left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a survival check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Survival?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jeepers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What in the (popping sound)?! That's my third one of the night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I do that one too? I can survival stuff pretty well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I assist Grog in finding if our footsteps were the last ones out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: True, I was giving this more as a means of giving the trained tracker a better look into this. I'll give you a simple perception check as you're not quite sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That'll be way worse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Worse than a natural one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But with Keyleth's help that will give you advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell. This room itself is pretty dark, the little sconces that hold this low flicker of eternal arcane light, they're just gently flickering on the sides of the walls, in the low light it's hard to make out any details of the ground and for the most part the stonework here seems unchanged.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We suck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we going onto the teleportation pad then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I think we assume we're walking into trouble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Trouble is our middles names.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, let's think of what happened last time we were here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There was a dragon, there was some loot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There was a bunch of gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There was a bunch of gold and there were three eyes in a wall--

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Saying they were coming for us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we crack one of them?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We did crack one of them. One cracked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They all cracked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But, wait weren't the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe they've reformed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were four orbs and then one eye showed up in one of the orbs and then all four cracked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't we send like a probe, can't you make a little person? A little fake little person?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can make a fake person to push something or lift something, but he won't be able to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He can't take a magic ride?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: These aren't the same gems that were holding Uriel's family, those were different.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. These were dragoneye things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These were palantirs hanging in a wall where another dragon somewhere peeked through and was pissed off.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it! Let's go through! Pow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As each one of you step on individually onto the platform, there's a brief moment of the wind beneath your stomach being lifted and you feel those butterflies hit as suddenly your imagery shifts and immediately you find yourself standing on a similar platform elsewhere. As you step off, as you feel force pushing you forward, as each individual starts appearing behind in rapid succession, immediately you notice the air change to extremely cold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right, it was in the mountain cave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Brimscythe's chambers. All the rocks have crumbled onto where the dragon hoard that you were rage-looting before, currently resided now just held beneath the boulders and rocks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get rid of those rocks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might be able to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are pockets of the cave that are walkable. To the left it ends to where the boulders and rubble had fallen, to the right it continues outward towards the outside of the mountain where you guys recall stepping to the edge of the precipice, and you notice that this mountain was very,very high up in the mountain range somewhere in the world where there was just ice and snow-capped mountains as far as you could see into this valley of high crags.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well if I recall, it wasn't too far from Stillben right? Because Keyleth recognized it as her home mountains? Like two hours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You recognize it as the Cliffkeep, which is the large mountain range to the north of Tal'Dorei which contains Kraghammer, the very south base contains Gatshadow, and it's where the Umbra Hills leads up into-- You don't know where in that range, it's a huge mountain range, but it's in that range.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there any sign of the pile of gold that Grog started rage-looting?

lines.name: MATT
